title: From March through August 2017, how many months will see Macau's monthly gross gaming revenues exceeding 2016 monthly revenues by 10% or more?
preds: I looked it up, and it looks good for macau.

Behind glitz of casinos, typhoon exposes Macau's infrastructure woes

As Macau Rebounds, Casinos Eye This Next Possible Gaming Hot Spot

https://www.reuters.com/article/us-macau-gambling-regulation-idUSKCN0YS0VA
Casino ATMs are using facial recognition to spot money launderers in Macau
https://www.theverge.com/2017/6/30/15903040/casino-atms-facial-recognition-money-launderers-macau
VIPs Keep Macau's Casino Revenue Recovering
https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-08-01/macau-casino-s-july-gains-cap-year-of-recovery-as-vips-return
Macau casinos’ revenue up
http://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2017/08/02/macau-casinos-revenue-up/
Macau casinos cash in again as China’s luxury sector rebounds
https://www.ft.com/content/7b925b16-3bb1-11e7-ac89-b01cc67cfeec
....because the nr. of rich people is increasing in China, and Macau belongs now to China. The Gov. of China has his interest to increase their incomes.

Large growth of rich and extremly rich people in China. Macau representing freedom.
Increase of revenues of the rich part of worldwide population.
Most of them investing in China and diverted by bookmaking/casino.

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/aug/23/typhoon-hato-hong-kong-battens-down-as-storm-closes-schools-and-stock-market but as the casinos have backup generators - no effect except maybe increase revenues people stranded (but safe) at Macau Hotels would have little else to do until storm clears and transport to mainland can run.
@z0k pointed out to be that I had put 100% in the wrong bin. I am humbled by the help and so many others of you are providing.
The obvious bet is that the casinos will continue to make huge growth. I thought that I might hedge my bet more but the month is so far gone that it would be nearly impossible not to make August.
5 of 6 months already exceeded 10% by an average of over 12%

Having making this forecast at the end of the month, i would say 99.8% chance of being all 6 months having looked at the ramp up in revenue over the last 16 months. if the prediction were to be made earlier the year i would have sided favorably with 4-5 months than 6 months. http://www.dicj.gov.mo/web/en/information/DadosEstat_mensal/2017/index.html
Well I have made a truly absurd number of predictions for a silly questions but here is one more. I now think it'll be all six months because revenues have been way up all year.
Updating from 0/0/10/90 thanks to info from @Dsarin [1]. [1] http://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/551504

Revenue over the last six months (February to July) increased between 16.3% and 29.2% over the corresponding month of 2016.  However, January 2017 was only 3.1% more than Jan 2016. The opening of first Wynn Macau and then Sands China's Parisian resort last year seems to have helped to reverse the 24 month slump up to August 2016, likely caused by China's anti-graft campaign and generally slower economic growth.  Revenue in August 2016 was 18.8 billion patacas, so to beat 10% August 2017 has to come in higher than 20.68. Three of the last 7 months have been below that figure, most recently June at 19.994, although July was comfortably higher at 22.964.  China's GDP grew at 6.9% in the second quarter, above expectations. http://www.reuters.com/article/us-macau-gambling-revenues-idUSKCN1173MF
http://www.dicj.gov.mo/web/en/information/DadosEstat_mensal/2017/index.html

The question asks from Mar through August, 5 months have seen greater revenues than last year. It is very probable that the last month will be the same. Monthly revenue has varied in the band from +13.0%
 to +18. Apr	20,162	17,341	+16.3%	83,640	73,517	+13.8%
May	22,742	18,389	+23.7%	106,382	91,906	+15.8%
Jun	19,994	15,881	+25.9%	126,377	107,787	+17.2%
Jul	22,964	17,774	+29.2%	149,340	125,560	+18.9%
http://www.dicj.gov.mo/web/en/information/DadosEstat_mensal/2017/index.html
Macau fears have died down, VIP's are back gambling again, and gaming revenues have risen each month for the last 11 months. Barring a disaster, it should be all 6 months.
They appear to be on a roll, should continue and will likely be much higher than 10%

the last 5 months have been over 10%. The first 3 were between 10-20%, the last 2 have been over 20%, no reason to think this trend is going to change. However, when looking at all the 2016 values (http://www.dicj.gov.mo/web/en/information/DadosEstat_mensal/2016/index.html) and comparing the July and August 2016 numbers to January, April, and May 2017 (the 3 lowest 2017 values) you see there is a possibility that the revenue may not exceed 10% from 2016 to 2017. 2 out of those 3 months values would not have exceeded a 10% change for July, and all 3 would not have exceeded the 10% threshold for August. However, with 4 out of the 6 months looked at being observed at >20,000, I believe it to be unlikely that a value <20,000 will occur again ( and twice in a row).
Following cryptocurrency resolution of scalability issues
On second thought that was a little too far.
I am shifting toward all six months both because of how the year is going and because Chinese economic fundamentals remain strong.
Fall from 19994 to 19551 not likely -  since 1.  2010 July rev has never been lower than prior month.  String of increasing positive variance now at 25+ percent.
union pay curb loosly applied in macau
It's likely but might not be in all months.   Unsure of how to translate this to the distribution.   Interesting question.

Extrapolating from relationships between revenues in different months [1,2,3]. June is usually quite a  bit lower than July or August. [1] http://www.dicj.gov.mo/web/en/information/DadosEstat_mensal/2017/index.html
[2] http://www.dicj.gov.mo/web/en/information/DadosEstat_mensal/2016/index.html
[3] http://www.dicj.gov.mo/web/en/information/DadosEstat_mensal/2015/index.html
Diversification to mass market is ensuring strong fundamentals.

http://www.reuters.com/article/us-macau-gambling-revenues-idUSKBN19M3AQ?il=0
The boys are back in town.

In an effort to curb currency outflows, "In May Macau placed new restrictions on cash machine withdrawals in the territory using Unionpay cards. China’s foreign exchange regulators this month instructed banks to provide daily reports on foreign Unionpay transactions above Rmb1000 ($147)."  FT.com Jun 29 If this extends to other debit cards could affect the question bins.

In the gaming industry, the invisible hand is almost always steered by organized crime in combination with government.  From my estimation, the major gaming categories in Macau are similar to any other major live casinos in the world, with the addition of onsite dog and horse racing.  Over 10% growth from 2016 has taken place every month since Chinese New Year in January.  Why is a big question.  People's Republic of China in combination with the Triads in combination with...?    http://www.dicj.gov.mo/web/en/information/DadosEstat_mensal/2017/index.html
https://www.forbes.com/sites/muhammadcohen/2017/03/06/as-macau-casino-revenue-soars-some-analysts-take-a-reality-check/#463d61cc1df9
 http://www.cnbc.com/2017/06/01/casino-stocks-rally-as-macaus-may-gaming-revenues-crush-estimates.html
 https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/how-the-brain-gets-addicted-to-gambling/

Looking at the data, Macau has already had 3 months (March, April, May) with monthly gross gambling revenues exceeding 2016 revenues by more than 10%. It seems highly likely that there will be at least 1 more, probably 2 more months where this occurs.

Revenues in the world's biggest casino hub of Macau jumped 24 percent in May, beating expectations and posting a 10-month winning streak as wealthy gamblers returned to the southern Chinese territory despite a corruption crackdown. Gambling revenue in the only place in China where casino gaming is legal rose to 22.7 billion patacas ($2.83 billion), government data showed on Thursday. Analysts were expecting growth of 15-20 percent.
http://www.reuters.com/article/us-macau-gambling-revenues-idUSKBN18S3X3?il=0
Macau is posting consistently higher returns and I'm shifting hard toward all six month as I think this trend continues.

There have been increases every month in 2017 so far, but 10% over 2016 monthly revenues every month seem impossible, especially given that second quarter earnings are traditionally lower than first quarter earnings.

- Loosend anti corruption laws in china
- Plenty of liquidity (due to rising properties prices which are used as credit against) 
- High number of mass market gamblers 
- New Pac On ferry connecting mainland china with macau's Cotai islands
- New Casinos, hotels,resorts openings

Shifting my prediction toward 4-5 and all 6 months because March and April were both much higher than 2016. It's still possible this is a blip because those months (plus May) were all down a lot in 2016 relative to historical revenues.
There are already two months of data suggesting MUCH higher revenues.  Not knowing anything else about this I'm simply extrapolating.

http://www.reuters.com/article/uk-macau-gambling-breakingviews-idUSKBN1810I4
The picture continues to brighten for the Macau casinos.  How nice for them.

Graft legislation is less of an issue here than is the movement away from VIPS to the general casino gambler. Marketing efforts will have a 2-3 month time lag from their Jan / Feb launches and this will have a positive effect until July (after which season trends will reestablish a short downshift).
Some adjustments toward consensus and toward 2-5 months.
Positive trend for the past 8 months, but only exceeded previous year by more than 10% in 3 months out of last 8. Numbers look good for past couple months though.

2016 was a weak year all the way until August. The monthly revenues for 2016 were (in patacas):
Feb: 19.5B
Mar: 17.9B
Apr: 17.3B
May: 18.4B
Jun: 15.9B
Jul: 17.7B
Aug: 18.9B
https://www.bloomberg.com/gadfly/articles/2017-04-06/macau-rolls-the-dice-on-china-s-luxury-renaissance For February 2017 the revenue was 23B. Assuming the revenue remains at exactly this level for every month until August gives year-on-year growth rates of: 28%, 33%, 25%, 45%, 30%, 22%. Of course the revenue will fluctuate, but even at the smallest there is a 12 % buffer to 10 % growth. The situation can change quickly, with aggressive US trade policies for example, but these would have to be implemented quickly to have an effect. Not to mention that Steve Wynn has been named finance chairman of the RNC and has a significant stake in Macau's casinos. https://www.forbes.com/sites/chasewithorn/2017/02/01/trumps-rival-turned-pal-billionaire-steve-wynn-named-rnc-finance-chair/#56caa3e651b6
i think the pivot tourist and leisure visitors will definitely help https://www.gamblinginsider.com/news/3074/macau-gaming-revenue-soars-18-in-march-as-the-region-continues-hot-streak

Revising because of comments @Dsarin.  I think it makes good sense to consider this a recovery year, but not a huge recovery to 2014 numbers, more like 2015 levels.  If we go on a tear and greatly exceed 10% for the next couple of months, I will revise my model and move aggressively in the upper tiers.
March 2017 was pretty strong.  I am definitely reversing my position here, assuming that results will be at least solidly better in 2017 than 2016.
Using consensus as have little time to research
More or less a normal distribution

March, April, and May were all depressed compared 2015, itself a down year. I think that gives Macao easy room to grow compared with 2016 for at least three months. As well, many of the issues in China's economy, such as its slowing momentum, are longer term problems that I don't think will explode; or if they do, will not before the leadership transition in the fall.
China economy continues to boom. New Lucky Dragon casino in Vegas won't significantly detract from overall economic growth.

The market is up right now but I think that most of the people who go to Macau are not seeing that benefit. Plus the thing with the new Sands casino which they had a big winner that messed up their profits in Q4 of 2016
China may have loosened the graft hunt but the economy is slowing and travel is getting harder.

Chinese GDP growth is expected to continue to slow. Macau gambling is driven by Chinese tourism.   The regeneration of casinos in Macau that is attracting  other nationalities is the reason for the 25% probability for 2-3 months.

Not buying that February performance constitutes a trend yet.  There are a few things that are overhanging this market, none of which will help its numbers.  If things look good for a month or three, I will definitely move up aggressively.  But on the other hand if March and April go poorly, I may bias even further to the downside.

https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-01-01/macau-gaming-revenue-extends-recovery-to-rise-8-in-december

Past seven month performance > 10%
Seasonality trends from past years
Unlikely to see extremes (0 and 6)
Bloomberg article suggests other factors could slow or reverse growth
